title: Drawing, "Oriental Scene", ca. 1770
markings: Watermark: A? Vimallin Auverone (?); J. Peoli mark on reverse, Lugt no. 2020
inscribed: At left faded initials of a signature, probaby "J. B. H."
provenance: Loizelet; J. Peoli, sale catalogue no. 331b.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Cattle at a watering place.  At right, stand an elderly man and a boy.  At left, kneels a man with a turban, and a child holds a Chinese cup. Jars and a cock are shown upon a horse, beside which a man stands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Oriental Scene", ca. 1770.
ca. 1770. Black crayon on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-263.
